        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Governance of Infrastructure (Phase 2)</common:Name>
        <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Gouvernance des infrastructures (phase 2)</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en"><p>The OECD dataset on the Governance of Infrastructure (Phase 2) contains the results of the 2022 OECD Survey on the Governance of Infrastructure. The database provides users with a unique resource on the governance of infrastructure in OECD countries. 
More specifically, it provides data on a set of governance dimensions, including stakeholder participation, regulatory framework and permitting procedures, management of threats to integrity, and environmental sustainability and climate resilience.</p> <h4>About this questionnaire</h4><p>The content of the database was collected using an online <a href="https://webfs.oecd.org/governmentataglance/Governance%20of%20infrastructure/2022%20OECD%20Survey%20on%20the%20Governance%20of%20Infrastructure.pdf" target="_blank">questionnaire</a> and a <a href="https://webfs.oecd.org/governmentataglance/Governance%20of%20infrastructure/2022%20OECD%20Survey%20on%20the%20Governance%20of%20Infrastructure_Glossary.pdf" target="_blank">glossary</a> was also provided. The 2022 OECD Survey on the Governance of Infrastructure was conducted in May-October 2022 by the Infrastructure and Public Procurement Division of the OECD Directorate for Public Governance. It covers the entire infrastructure life cycle mapping out governments’ decision making processes, tools and norms of interaction in the areas of stakeholder participation, regulation and permitting, integrity, evidence-informed decision making, sustainability and climate resilience.The 2022 Survey covers four of the ten pillars set out in the <a href="https://legalinstruments.oecd.org/en/instruments/OECD-LEGAL-0460" target="_blank">OECD Recommendation on the Governance of Infrastructure</a> adopted by the OECD Executive Council in 2020. Additionally, it covers the cross-cutting theme of environmental sustainability and climate resilience. The first three pillars of the OECD Recommendation (strategic planning; fiscal sustainability, affordability and value for money; and public procurement) were covered in the 2020 OECD Survey on the Governance of Infrastructure (Phase 1).The dataset for the 2020 Survey is available <a href="https://webfs.oecd.org/governmentataglance/Governance%20of%20infrastructure/2020%20Governance%20of%20Infrastructure.zip" target="_blank">here.</a></p><p>The goal of the 2022 Survey was to gather data and provide an improved understanding of current practices and procedures in infrastructure governance in OECD countries. The data collected allows for international comparative analysis, benchmarking of best practices, and monitoring of change in infrastructure governance practices over time in the following dimensions:</p><p><strong>Part I: Ensure transparent, systematic and effective stakeholder participation<br/>Part II: Promote a coherent, predictable, and efficient regulatory framework<br/>Part III: Implement a whole of government approach to manage threats to integrity<br/>Part IV: Promote evidence-informed decision making<br/>Part V: Deliver environmentally sustainable and climate-resilient infrastructure</strong><br/></p><p>A composite indicator was developed for each of the five parts of the survey (available <a href="https://data-explorer.oecd.org/vis?lc=en&df[ds]=Design&df[id]=DSD_GOV%40DF_GOV_INFPD_2023&df[ag]=OECD.GOV.GIP&df[vs]=1.0&av=true&pd=%2C&dq=A......&ly[rw]=MEASURE&ly[cl]=REF_AREA&to[TIME_PERIOD]=false&lo=5&lom=LASTNPERIODS" target="_blank">here</a>). This database covers parts I, II, III and V of the survey. It comprises 34 OECD countries.The data draw heavily upon self-reporting from governments representing the country’s own assessment of current practices and procedures. Respondents are predominantly senior officials in the central/federal ministries of infrastructure, public works and finance, as well as in infrastructure agencies and other line ministries. The data refers mostly to central/federal governments and excludes the subnational level.</p></common:Description>

        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QII17-SQ004">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">368</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">No</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QII17" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LR_QII18">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">369</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Are stakeholders* informed on how and why their input has been considered in the permitting* procedure?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_II" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LT_QIIB">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">370</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Please use this space to provide additional comments, relevant weblinks and/or references in relation to answers provided in this section, if needed.</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_II" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LT_QII19">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">371</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Independence of economic regulators  This variable will be built using the 2018 OECD Indicators on the Governance of Sector Regulators. The Indicators on the Governance of Sector Regulators capture the governance arrangements of economic regulators in the energy, e-communications, rail transport, air transport and water sectors, and are structured around three pillars: independence, accountability and scope of action. More information on the structure of the indicators, the underlying questions</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_II" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LT_QII20">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">372</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Accountability of economic regulators  This variable will be built using the 2018 OECD Indicators on the Governance of Sector Regulators. The Indicators on the Governance of Sector Regulators capture the governance arrangements of economic regulators in the energy, e-communications, rail transport, air transport and water sectors, and are structured around three pillars: independence, accountability and scope of action. More information on the structure of the indicators, the underlying question</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_II" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LT_QIIC">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">373</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Please use this space to provide additional comments, relevant weblinks and/or references in relation to answers provided in this section, if needed.</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_II" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LT_QII">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">374</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">As part of the implementation of the OECD Recommendation on the Governance of Infrastructure, we are identifying case studies that can illustrate how the ten key dimensions of the Recommendation are put in practice by OECD countries. These case studies will be part of a repository of good practices that will be shared in the Infrastructure Governance Toolkit. It will be an interesting opportunity to showcase reforms and efforts implemented by your country to other OECD countries and internationa</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_II" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Part_III">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">375</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Implement a whole of government approach to manage threats to integrity</common:Name>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LC_QIII1">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">376</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Are strategic objectives established in policy documents/government plans to mitigate public integrity* risks in infrastructure management?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LC_QIII1-comment">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">377</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">comment</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_LC_QIII1" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LR_QIII2">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">378</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Do such strategic objectives outline outcome-level indicators to safeguard public integrity* in infrastructure management?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LR_QIII3">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">379</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Are such strategic objectives backed by an action plan in force?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LC_QIII4">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">380</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Within the last five years, has a government body prepared and published an analytical report on public integrity* risks in infrastructure management?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LC_QIII4-comment">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">381</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">comment</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_LC_QIII4" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LR_QIII5">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">382</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Is each major infrastructure undertaking backed by an assessment of public integrity* risks, identifying as a minimum specific types of relevant integrity* breaches, the actors likely to be involved, as well as the expected likelihood and impact if the risk materialises?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LR_QIII6">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">383</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Does the risk management framework in infrastructure explicitly address public integrity* risks?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LT_QIIIA">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">384</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Please use this space to provide additional comments, relevant weblinks and/or references in relation to answers provided in this section, if needed.</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII7">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">385</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Does your country have an explicit policy or institutional framework in place regulating situations when there is a conflict of interest* in infrastructure management?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII7-SQ001">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">386</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, as part of a wider framework applicable to all public officials</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII7" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII7-SQ002">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">387</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, for project assessment and selection</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII7" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII7-SQ003">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">388</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, for the tendering and award stages</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII7" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII7-SQ004">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">389</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, for the contract management stage</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII7" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII7-SQ005">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">390</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, for evaluation and audit purposes</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII7" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII7-SQ006">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">391</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">No</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII7" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_LR_QIII8">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">392</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">If the regulatory framework* includes a definition of conflict of interest*, does it include the following?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII9">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">393</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Does the regulatory framework* on conflict of interest* for infrastructure management officials include rules relative to gifts and gratuities?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII9-SQ001">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">394</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, but it is not exclusive for infrastructure management officials</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII9" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII9-SQ002">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">395</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, setting a monetary threshold above which gifts/gratuities are forbidden</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII9" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII9-SQ003">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">396</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, mandating the declaration of gifts and gratuities in a register</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII9" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII9-SQ004">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">397</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, mandating the declaration of gifts/gratuities in a public register</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII9" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII9-SQ005">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">398</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">No</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII9" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII10">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">399</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Does the regulatory framework* on conflict of interest* for infrastructure management officials include rules relative to pre- or post-public employment*?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII10-SQ001">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">400</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, but it is not exclusive for infrastructure management officials</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII10" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII10-SQ002">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">401</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, on pre-public employment*</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII10" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII10-SQ003">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">402</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, on post-public employment*</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII10" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII10-SQ004">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">403</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, setting cool-off periods*</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII10" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII10-SQ005">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">404</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, setting other mechanisms to control the conflict of interest* (i.e., exit interviews, committees/working groups to review specific situations, etc.)</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII10" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII10-SQ006">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">405</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">No</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII10" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII11">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">406</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Which policies/mechanisms are used to identify, prevent, and manage conflicts of interest* of infrastructure management officials?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII11-SQ001">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">407</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Regulatory framework* includes a definition of a conflict of interest* for infrastructure management officials</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII11" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII11-SQ002">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">408</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Infrastructure management officials have to declare their private interests</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII11" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII11-SQ003">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">409</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Infrastructure management officials have to declare ‘no conflict of interest*’ or notify the competent authority in case of potential conflict of interest*</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII11" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII11-SQ004">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">410</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Certain public officials have limitations in participating in infrastructure management</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII11" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII11-SQ005">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">411</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">None of the above</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII11" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII12">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">412</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Are infrastructure management officials required to submit an interest declaration to an internal control* function?</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII12-SQ001">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">413</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, upon taking over the public position</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII12" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII12-SQ002">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">414</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, periodically (for example, every year or every two years)</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII12" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII12-SQ003">
          <common:Annotations>
            <common:Annotation id="@SDMX">
              <common:AnnotationType>ORDER</common:AnnotationType>
              <common:AnnotationText xml:lang="en">415</common:AnnotationText>
            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, upon leaving the public administration</common:Name>
          <structure:Parent>
            <Ref id="Q_MC_QIII12" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QIII12-SQ004">
          <common:Annotations>

            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">As part of the implementation of the OECD Recommendation on the Governance of Infrastructure, we are identifying case studies that can illustrate how the ten key dimensions of the Recommendation are put in practice by OECD countries. These case studies will be part of a repository of good practices that will be shared in the Infrastructure Governance Toolkit. It will be an interesting opportunity to showcase reforms and efforts implemented by your country to other OECD countries and internationa</common:Name>

            <Ref id="Part_III" />
          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>

            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Does your country have any mechanisms and/or arrangements in place to co-ordinate environmental and climate aspects of infrastructure investments between sectors (e.g. inter-ministerial committee, cross-ministerial plan, ad-hoc cross-sectoral co-ordination platform)?</common:Name>

Country answers to the question are provided by government bodies responsible for regulatory reform, and can be accessed here.   Please use this space to provide additional info</common:Name>

        <structure:Code id="Q_LC_QV28-comment">

        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QV29">

          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Are the results of public infrastructure procurement processes measured with respect to green objectives?</common:Name>

        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QV29-SQ001">

          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Yes, environmental benefits of infrastructure procurement are measured during contract awarding</common:Name>

        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QV29-SQ002">

        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QV29-SQ003">

          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Are environmental or climate objectives integrated into infrastructure procurement?</common:Name>

        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QV30-SQ001">

          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Environmental requirements must be included in technical specifications of infrastructure projects</common:Name>

        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QV30-SQ002">

        <structure:Code id="Q_MC_QV30-SQ003">

          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Awarded suppliers must follow international standards and codes (i.e. ISO , FIDIC) through contract clauses to ensure planned GHG emissions and climate resilience* levels</common:Name>

        <structure:Code id="Q_LT_QVD">

        <structure:Code id="Q_LR_QV31">

          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Does your country undertake ex post review or audits of environmental and climate change assessments of public infrastructure?</common:Name>

        <structure:Code id="Q_LC_QV32">

        <structure:Code id="Q_LT_QVE">

            </common:Annotation>
          </common:Annotations>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">As part of the implementation of the OECD Recommendation on the Governance of Infrastructure, we are identifying case studies that can illustrate how the ten key dimensions of the Recommendation are put in practice by OECD countries. These case studies will be part of a repository of good practices that will be shared in the Infrastructure Governance Toolkit. It will be an interesting opportunity to showcase reforms and efforts implemented by your country to other OECD countries and internationa</common:Name>

          </structure:Parent>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
      <structure:Codelist id="CL_FREQ" agencyID="SDMX" version="2.1" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Code list for concept "Frequency"</common:Name>
        <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Codelist pour le concept "Fréquence"</common:Name>
        <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code list provides a set of values indicating
					the "frequency" of the data (e.g. weekly, monthly, quarterly). The concept
					"frequency" may refer to various stages in the production process, e.g. data
					collection or data dissemination. For example, a time series could be
					disseminated at annual frequency but the underlying data are compiled monthly.
					The code list is applicable for all different uses of
					"frequency".</common:Description>
        <common:Description xml:lang="fr">Cette liste de codes fournit un ensemble de valeurs
					indiquant la "fréquence" des données (par exemple, hebdomadaire, mensuelle,
					trimestrielle). Le concept de "fréquence" peut faire référence à différentes
					étapes du processus de production, par ex. collecte ou diffusion de données. Par
					exemple, une série chronologique pourrait être diffusée à une fréquence
					annuelle, mais les données sous-jacentes sont compilées mensuellement. La liste
					de codes est applicable pour toutes les différentes utilisations de
					"fréquence".</common:Description>
        <structure:Code id="A">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Annual</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Annuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every year</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Biennale</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Biennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every two years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Triennale</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Triennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every three years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A4">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Quadrennial</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Quadriennale</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every four years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A5">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Quinquennale</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Quinquennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every five years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A10">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Décennale</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Decennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every ten years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A20">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Bidécennal</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Bidecennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every twenty years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A30">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Tridécennal</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Tridecennial</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every thirty years</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="A_3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Three times a year</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Trois fois par an</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						three times a year</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="S">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Half-yearly, semester</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Semestrielle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every semester</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Quarterly</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Trimestrielle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every quarter</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Mensuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Monthly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every month</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Bimestrielle</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Bimonthly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every two months</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M_2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Semi-mensuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Semimonthly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						twice a month</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M_3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Three times a month</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Trois fois par mois</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						three times a month</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Hebdomadaire</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Weekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every week</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Aux 2 semaines</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Biweekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every two weeks</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Aux 3 semaines</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Triweekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every three weeks</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W4">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Aux 4 semaines</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Four-weekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every four weeks</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W_2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Bihebdomadaire</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Semiweekly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						twice a week</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W_3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Three times a week</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Trois fois par semaine</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						three times a week</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="D">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Daily</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Quotidienne</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every day</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="D_2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Deux fois par jour</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Twice a day</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						twice a day</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Horaire</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Hourly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every hour</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H2">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Bihoraire</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Bihourly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every two hours</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H3">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Trihoraire</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Trihourly</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used for data collected or disseminated
						every three hours</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="B">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Daily – business week</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Jours ouvrable</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Similar to "daily", however there are no
						observations for Saturdays and Sundays (so, neither “missing values” nor
						“numeric values” should be provided for Saturday and
						Sunday)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="N">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Chaque minute</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Minutely</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">While N denotes "minutely", usually, there may be
						no observations every minute (for several series the frequency is usually
						"irregular" within a day/days). And though observations may be sparse (not
						collected or disseminated every minute), missing values do not need to be
						given for the minutes when no observations exist: in any case the time stamp
						determines when an observation is observed</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="I">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Irregular</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Irrégulière</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used with irregular time series that stores
						data for a sequence of arbitrary timepoints. Irregular time series are
						appropriate when the data arrives unpredictably, such as when the
						application records every stock trade or when random events are recorded
						(the interval between each element can be a different
						length)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="OA">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Occasional annual</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Occasionnelle annuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">The event occurs occasionally with an infrequent
						update that could span from 1 year to several years between events. It
						implies a survey that experiences a gap for several years prior to the next
						survey update (this is commonly linked to funding available to run a
						specific survey (i.e. health surveys), whereas a regular annual survey
						refers typically to ‘programs’ that are funded regularly and fall under the
						Statistics Act, and therefore never experience a gap)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="OM">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Occasional monthly</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Occasionnelle mensuelle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">The event occurs occasionally with an infrequent
						update that could span from 1 month to several months between events. It
						implies a survey that experiences a gap for several months prior to the next
						survey update</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="_O">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Autre</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Other</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used when the qualitative or quantitative
						values that a variable takes in a data set is associated to multiple
						occurrences with frequency other than the already defined ones (for example
						every 5 hours and 32 minutes etc.)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="_U">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Non spécifié</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unspecified</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used when a set of values are reported
						within a time range but not associated to sub ranges. Often this could
						happen in case of missing or sparse information. (Let’s say we have two
						observations for 2020 but we do not know if they are part of a monthly
						reporting or quarterly reporting)</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="_Z">
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">N'est pas applicable</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Not applicable</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used when the qualitative or quantitative
						values that a variable takes in a data set is not associated to multiple
						occurrences (only single occurrence exists) one can use the _Z as
						frequency</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>
      <structure:Codelist id="CL_OBS_STATUS" agencyID="SDMX" version="2.2" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation Status</common:Name>
        <structure:Code id="A">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Normal value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">To be used as default value if no value is provided or when no special coded qualification is assumed. Usually, it can be assumed that the source agency assigns sufficient confidence to the provided observation and/or the value is not expected to be dramatically revised.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="B">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Time series break</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observations are characterised as such when different content exists or a different methodology has been applied to this observation as compared with the preceding one (the one given for the previous period).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="D">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Definition differs</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to indicate slight deviations from the established methodology (footnote-type information); these divergences do not imply a break in time series.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="E">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Estimated value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation obtained through an estimation methodology (e.g. to produce back-casts) or based on the use of a limited amount of data or ad hoc sampling and through additional calculations (e.g. to produce a value at an early stage of the production stage while not all data are available). It may also be used in case of experimental data (e.g. in the context of a pilot ahead of a full scale production process) or in case of data of (anticipated/assessed) low quality. If needed, additional information can be provided through free text using the COMMENT_OBS attribute at the observation level or at a higher level. This code is to be used when the estimation is done by a sender agency. When the imputation is carried out by a receiver agency in order to replace or fill gaps in reported data series, the flag to use is I "Value imputed by a receiving agency".</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="F">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Forecast value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Value deemed to assess the magnitude which a quantity will assume at some future point of time (as distinct from "estimated value" which attempts to assess the magnitude of an already existent quantity).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="G">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Experimental value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Data collected on the basis of definitions or (alternative) collection methods under development. Data not of guaranteed quality as normally expected from provider.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="I">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Value imputed by a receiving agency</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation imputed by a receiving agency to replace or fill gaps in reported data series. This code is intended to cover all cases where a receiving agency publishes data about a sending agency that do not come from an official source in the sender agency's reporting framework. When the estimation is done by the sender agency, the flag to use is E "Estimated value".</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="K">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Data included in another category</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is used when data for a given category are missing and are included in another category, sub-total or total. Generally where code "K" is used there should be a corresponding code "W - Includes data from another category" assigned to the over-covered category. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify under which category the data are included.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="W">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Includes data from another category</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is used when data include another category, or go beyond the scope of the data collection and are therefore over-covered. Generally, where code "W" is used there should be a corresponding code "K - Data included in another category" assigned to the category which is under-covered. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify which additional data are included.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="O">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This code is to be used when no breakdown is made between the reasons why data are missing. Data can be missing due to many reasons: data cannot exist, data exist but are not collected (e.g. because they are below a certain threshold or subject to a derogation clause), data are unreliable, etc.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="M">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; data cannot exist</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to denote empty cells resulting from the impossibility to collect a statistical value (e.g. a particular education level or type of institution may be not applicable to a given country's education system).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="P">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Provisional value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">An observation is characterised as "provisional" when the source agency - while it bases its calculations on its standard production methodology - considers that the data, almost certainly, are expected to be revised.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="S">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Strike and other special events</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Special circumstances (e.g. strike) affecting the observation or causing a missing value.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="L">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; data exist but were not collected</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used, for example, when some data are not reported/disseminated because they are below a certain threshold.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="H">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; holiday or weekend</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used in some daily data flows.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="Q">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Missing value; suppressed</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used, for example, when data are suppressed due to statistical confidentiality considerations.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="J">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Derogation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Clause in an agreement (e.g. legal act, gentlemen's agreement) stating that some provisions in the agreement are not to be implemented by designated parties; these derogations may affect the observation or cause a missing value. In general, derogations are limited in time.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="N">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Not significant</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Used to indicate a value which is not a "real" zero (e.g. a result of 0.0004 rounded to zero).</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="U">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Low reliability</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">This indicates existing observations, but for which the user should also be aware of the low quality assigned.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
        <structure:Code id="V">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unvalidated value</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Observation as received from the respondent without further evaluation of data quality.</common:Description>
        </structure:Code>
      </structure:Codelist>

    <structure:Concepts>
      <structure:ConceptScheme id="CS_GOV_QDD_INFRA" agencyID="OECD.GOV.GIP" version="1.0" isFinal="true">
        <common:Name xml:lang="en">QDD Concepts</common:Name>
        <structure:Concept id="REF_AREA">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Reference area</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Zone de référence</common:Name>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="FREQ">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Frequency of observation</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Fréquence d'observation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Time interval at which observations occur over a given time period.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="TIME_PERIOD">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Time period</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Période temporelle</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Timespan or point in time to which the observation actually refers.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="MEASURE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Measure</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Mesure</common:Name>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="OBS_VALUE">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation value</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Valeur d'observation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Value of a particular variable.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="OBS_STATUS">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Observation status</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Statut d'observation</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Information on the quality of a value or an unusual or missing value.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
        <structure:Concept id="UNIT_MULT">
          <common:Name xml:lang="en">Unit multiplier</common:Name>
          <common:Name xml:lang="fr">Multiplicateur d'unité</common:Name>
          <common:Description xml:lang="en">Exponent in base 10 specified so that multiplying the observation numeric values by 10^UNIT_MULT gives a value expressed in the unit of measure.</common:Description>
        </structure:Concept>
      </structure:ConceptScheme>
    </structure:Concepts>
